title: Apple's iPhone 11 Pro and Samsung Galaxy S10 cameras compared: which is best?
text:
If you're considering buying Apple's iPhone 11 Pro, then it's probably because you've been lured in by its triple camera system.

Apple's three lenses allow users to, among other things, take ultra wide-angle shots and give their portrait images tastefully blurred backgrounds.

The iPhone 11 Pro, which starts at £1,049, also comes with various technical sounding software like smart HDR processing and something Apple calls “semantic rendering”, for clearer shots.

But how good is the camera system compared to rivals? We pitted the iPhone 11 against the Samsung's new S10 5G smartphone (£1,100), which comes with four rear cameras, to find out.

Ultra wide

From an ultra wide angle with both the iPhone...
description: If you're considering buying Apple's iPhone 11 Pro, then it's probably because you've been lured in by its triple camera system.
